social_posts.post_text:
My show Form of Flight is opening tomorrow at @francoisghebaly New York 5-7pm 🤍🤍 🥰 I would love to see you there ✨
-

Excerpt from the press release:
 
François Ghebaly is proud to present Form of Flight, New York-based artist Ivana Bašić’s first solo exhibition with the gallery. The wall-based sculptures and drawings on display offer an introduction to the formal strategies and unique material language that the artist has developed over the course of her practice—what the artist calls “a language of becoming."

Yugoslavian-born artist Ivana Bašić has for over a decade endeavored at an artistic and philosophical workspace far beyond the conventional bounds of human or organic form. To the contrary, her figures are metamorphic, in states of shifting biological, physical, and metaphysical identity. Charged by the artist’s early vantage of violence and brutality brought on by the collapse of Yugoslavia, Bašić’s multidisciplinary practice levies a posthumanist lens to investigate our most pressing ontological fixations: the fragility of the human condition; the breakdown of self and other; a reimagination of life and death; and a quest for immortality.

For Form of Flight, these lines of inquiry converge in a body of sculptures and drawings that point toward still further possibilities of existence. The exhibition title is taken from Catherine Malabou’s “The Ontology of the Accident," wherein Malabou describes metamorphosis as a substitute for flight when there is nowhere left to retreat or hide: “The only possible way out from the impossibility of flight appears to be the formation of a form of flight. In other words, the formation of an identity that flees itself," as a way to free itself.

-
Full press release link in bio. Thank you @wesley_h_  for a beautiful text 💜💜 #ivanabasic

Install shots of my show Form of Flight at @francoisghebaly New York💐 Thank you @blaizelehane @wesley_h_ & @araphulu 💜✨🤍🤍for all the help and support. The show is up till January 21st. Stop by!
#ivanabasic

30 x 22 in

Au-delà opening today at @lafayetteanticipations conceived in the luminous mind of @agnesgryczkowska 💐🖤🖤✨

Bringing together artists from across different generations, Au-delà transforms Lafayette Anticipations into a journey evoking rituals at once ancient and contemporary, individual and collective, pagan and divine, in the search of a new sacred, a new unifying force.

My piece, I sense that all of this is ancient and vast. I had touched the nothing, and nothing was living and moist., 2020, is a part of the second chapter of the exhibition revealing a world which questions the very essence of transcendence and metamorphosis—of life and death, of the cyclicality of all matter and existence.

So happy to be a part of this show don’t miss it if you are in Paris, I will be there in spirit. 🌬🤍

Thank you @marvalcollection for generously lending the piece & @francesca_mininifor help & support. 💐

#ivanabasic

37 years on this planet today ✨so happy and grateful for this life and everyone in it 🙏🥰❤️ an ode to the little Esperanza bug 🥹 who landed on my hand three years ago at the exact moment I was blowing candles for my birthday, when I was going through some really difficult time, just to remind me that Universe is always with me🌬️🌌✨❤️

Human is” on view at @schinkelpavillon 
🖤🪸🖤🔥
-

Distinctions between dystopia and reality are increasingly collapsing in the face of inexhorable tech-nological and ecological upheavals. Against this backdrop, Human Is employs science fiction as a spiritual and aesthetic vehicle to mobilize alternative futures, political imagination and a new posthuman ethics.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Artists:
Joachim Bandau, Ivana Bašić @ivana_basic Ian Cheng, @eyecheng David Cronenberg, Matthew Angelo Harrison, Tishan Hsu, Mike Kelley @mike_kelley_foundation Alexander Kluge, Tetsumi Kudo, Laika, Sidsel Meineche Hansen @no_sid Nour Mobarak @adult_nour Fritz Lang, Sandra Mujinga @iamsandramujinga Diane Severin Nguyen @_melancholia Ovartaci, Analisa Teachworth, @analisa_ Suzanne Treister, Mary Shelley and WangShui @wangshui_ 

Curated by Nina Pohl #ninapohl & Franziska Sophie Wildförster  @franziskasophiewildfoerster 
Project Management @teresa.mi.nn 
Research assistant @smstpls Initial curatorial idea by Laura López Paniagua

#ivanabasic

Last week of Au Delà ❤️‍🔥 at @lafayetteanticipations curated by @agnesgryczkowska 🤍 One of my favorite shows ever. 🤲✨ So grateful to have been a part of it 🙏 Don’t miss it if in Paris, only a few more days left. 
-

Bringing together artists from across different generations, Au-delà transforms Lafayette Anticipations into a journey evoking rituals at once ancient and contemporary, individual and collective, pagan and divine, in the search of a new sacred, a new unifying force.

While the world becomes increasingly wounded and desecrated and people seem more detached from the magic and power of the earth, the desire to invent and reinvent rituals and languages which would enable us to reach the sacred can be seen as a reaction to the degradation of the living, a counterculture responding to the general profanity of life. The subject of ritual—what makes us chant and dance, laugh and cry, dwell and transcend—tells a part of the history of our humanity while also outlining the one we hope to invent.  
→ Alicia Adamerovich · Korakrit Arunanondchai & Alex Gvojic · Ivana Bašić · Hildegard von Bingen · Bianca Bondi · Romeo Castellucci · Matthew Angelo Harrison · Eva Hesse · Janina Kraupe-Świderska · Wifredo Lam · Michèle Lamy · Tau Lewis · Kat Lyons · Kali Malone · Ana Mendieta · Christelle Oyiri · Tobias Spichtig · TARWUK · Jeanne Vicerial · Anna Zemánková. As well as Cycladic idols and a Punic stele.
Curator : Agnes Gryczkowska

Thank you to @marvalcollection and @valeri.art for generously lending the piece 💜 and @francesca_minini for all the help and support 💐💐#ivanabasic

From the dust it is roused, 
the Body Pneumatic
2023

Wax, breath, race-car exhaust manifolds, bronze, steatite, blown glass, pressure stainless steel, petroleum jelly

#ivanabasic

So happy and honored to be the recipient of the 2023 NYFA/ NYSCA Fellowship in Sculpture!❤️✨🌌 Proud to be a part of this important program that has supported New York artists for 38 years. 

As an autodidact with no formal art training and an immigrant from the country that has been economically and culturally decimated by wars and political turmoil while I was growing up, it has been a steep and incredible path, and I am deeply grateful for all the support I have received along the way. 🙏✨

Thank you to @nyfacurrent @nyscouncilonthearts and the panelists for this recognition and support. And congratulations to all the fellow artists! 💜💐✨
